section.title: Time phrases with the Past simple
section.sectiontitle: We use the Past simple to talk about past actions or states which are finished. We use it with times, days, dates, years and with last and ago.
section.sectiontitle2: We use the Past simple with questions and statements with when.

section.title: Time phrases with the Present perfect
section.sectiontitle: We often use the Present perfect to talk about an action when we do not know exactly when it happened.
section.text1: I went to Spain at some time but we don't know when.
section.text2: She met the President at some time in her life but we don't know when.
section.sectiontitle2: When we use time words with the Present perfect they do not mean a definite time. Just means a short time ago and already means before now/before expected.
section.text3a: She's just had her first baby.

section.title: Time phrases with the Present perfect
section.sectiontitle: yet means before now; we use it in questions and negatives.
